attributes.action: increase salaries within central london to a 'Living Wage' that reflect high living prices.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Guardian journalist Polly Toynbee wrote a fascinating insight into living on minimum wage in the 1980's Thatcher era.  Not a lot appears to have changed!  House prices rise, Ken Livingstone increases travel expenses and yet we are all expected to continue on our meagre salaries.  All I ask is that our salaries are controlled to reflect this ever consuming rises - and if that cannot be done, inflation stablised so we can afford to buy our London property and take the bus to work.  vive la revolution, people!
